member.summary: Last time we looked that this peer was choking us

member.name: M:MonoTorrent.Client.PeerId.GetDownloadRate
member.summary:
Get our download rate from this peer -- this is Dp.
1. If we are not choked by this peer, return the actual measure download rate. 2. If we are choked, then attempt to make an educated guess at the download rate using the following steps - use the rate of Have messages received from this peer as an estimate of its download rate - assume that its upload rate is equivalent to its estimated download rate - divide this upload rate by the standard implementation's active set size for that rate

member.name: T:MonoTorrent.Client.Encryption.RC4
member.summary: RC4 encryption

member.name: F:MonoTorrent.Client.EncryptionTypes.None
member.summary: is initially set to . If a connection cannot be established using a given method that method is removed from the list. If every method fails then the peer will be set to and no further connections will be attempted. By setting then encrypted and unencrypted connections are both disallowed.

member.name: F:MonoTorrent.Client.EncryptionTypes.PlainText
member.summary: Nothing is encrypted. This is the fastest but allows deep packet inspection to detect the bittorrent handshake. If connections are being closed before the handshake completes, or very soon after it completes, then it's possible that the ISP is closing them, and so RC4 based methods may prevent that from happening.

member.name: F:MonoTorrent.Client.EncryptionTypes.RC4Header
member.summary: Encryption is applied to the initial handshaking process only. Once the connection has been established all further data is sent in plain text. This is the second fastest and should prevent deep packet inspection from detecting the bittorrent handshake.

member.name: F:MonoTorrent.Client.EncryptionTypes.RC4Full
member.summary: Encryption is applied to the initial handshake and to all subsequent data transfers.

member.name: F:MonoTorrent.Client.EncryptionTypes.All
member.summary: Both encrypted and unencrypted connections are allowed.

member.name: T:MonoTorrent.Client.PiecePicking.SlidingWindowPicker
member.summary:
Generates a sliding window with high, medium, and low priority sets. The high priority set is downloaded first and in order. The medium and low priority sets are downloaded rarest first.
This is intended to be used with a BitTorrent streaming application.
The high priority set represents pieces that are needed SOON. This set is updated by calling code, to adapt for events (e.g. user fast-forwards or seeks, etc.)

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.PiecePicking.SlidingWindowPicker.HighPrioritySetStart
member.summary: Gets or sets first "high priority" piece. The n pieces after this will be requested in-order, the rest of the file will be treated rarest-first

member.summary: Gets or sets the size, in pieces, of the high priority set.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.PiecePicking.SlidingWindowPicker.MediumToHighRatio
member.summary: This is the size ratio between the medium and high priority sets. Equivalent to mu in Tribler's Give-to-get paper. Default value is 4.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.PiecePicking.SlidingWindowPicker.MediumPrioritySetSize
member.summary: Read-only value for size of the medium priority set. To set the medium priority size, use MediumToHighRatio.

member.name: T:MonoTorrent.Client.ConnectionFailureReason
member.summary: Lists potential reasons why an outgoing connection could not be established.

member.name: F:MonoTorrent.Client.ConnectionFailureReason.Unreachable
member.summary: The remote peer did not accept the connection. This might mean the client has gone offline or the client is behind a NAT/Firewall and cannot accept incoming connections.

member.name: F:MonoTorrent.Client.ConnectionFailureReason.EncryptionNegiotiationFailed
member.summary: After accepting the connection, a compatible connection encryption method could not be selected. Alternatively the remote peer could have reached it's open connection limit and simply closed the connection, or it could mean the peer did not support encrypted connections.

member.name: F:MonoTorrent.Client.ConnectionFailureReason.HandshakeFailed
member.summary: A compatible connection encryption method was selected, but the peer closed the connection after the normal handshake was sent. This could mean the remote peer reached it's open connection limit and simply closed the connection, or it could mean the peer did not actually support the chosen encryption. This can happen if we choose to create an unencrypted outgoing connection and the peer only supports encrypted connections.

member.name: F:MonoTorrent.Client.ConnectionFailureReason.Unknown
member.summary: There is no clear reason why the connection attempt failed.

If the manager is in the Downloading state then this will return '1' as the torrent will have been fully hashed already. member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.AllowHaveSuppression
member.summary: Have suppression reduces the number of Have messages being sent by only sending Have messages to peers which do not already have that piece. A peer will never request a piece they have already downloaded, so informing them that we have that piece is not beneficial. Defaults to .

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.ConnectionTimeout
member.summary: If a connection attempt does not complete within the given timeout, it will be cancelled so a connection can be attempted with a new peer. Defaults to 10 seconds. It is highly recommended to keep this value within a range of 7-15 seconds unless absolutely necessary.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.MaximumDiskWriteRate
member.summary: The maximum disk write speed, in bytes per second. A value of 0 means unlimited. This is typically only useful for non-SSD drives to prevent the downloading process from saturating the available drive bandwidth. If the download speed exceeds the max write rate then the download will be throttled. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.ReportedAddress

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.PreferEncryption
member.summary: If this is set to false and allows , then unencrypted connections will be used by default for new outgoing connections. Otherwise, if allows or then an encrypted connection will be used by default for new outgoing connections. Defaults to .

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.TorrentSettings.ConnectionRetentionFactor
member.summary: When considering peers that have given us data, the inactivity manager will wait TimeToWaiTUntilIdle plus (Number of bytes we've been sent / ConnectionRetentionFactor) seconds before they are eligible for disconnection. Default value is 2000. A value of 0 prevents the inactivity manager from disconnecting peers that have sent data.
